basics.name: Kangsheng("Hurley") Qi
basics.summary: Motivated and highly skilled candidate with Bachelor's degrees in Computer Science and Mathematics, and strong foundation and research experience in computer science and computational biology. Experienced in machine learning, bioinformatics, and data analysis. Eager to pursue a Ph.D. to further investigate the intersections of biology, computer science, and mathematics

work.name: The Oden Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences, UT Austin
summary: Conduct interviews with distinguished faculty members on advanced multidisciplinary research projects
Assist graduate students with administrative tasks, including on boarding, coordinating project activities, and others
Organize events featuring distinguished speakers, handling logistics such as venue arrangements and promotional activities

work.name: PHYZ Lab, UT Austin
summary: Utilized chaos theory, time series analysis, deep learning, neural networks, and mathematical modeling to predict NICU patient health patterns, septic rates, and discharge times. This work, supervised by Dr. Joshua Chang, aimed to enhance medical treatment applications and support healthcare professionals

Collaborated with medical professionals, clinicians, and distinguished researchers to understand and provide feedback on various projects, including electroceuticals, gait analysis, and delirium forecasting

work.name: Dr. Can Cenik Lab, UT Austin
summary: Investigate translation efficiency on C. Elegans genes utilizing in-lab softwares
Develop advanced methods for functional prediction based on translation efficiency calculations
Predict novel gene function for C. Elegans genes based and obtained validation from collaborators

work.name: Dr. Stephen Yi Lab, UT Austin
summary: Conducted research focused on enhancer motif analysis and DNA functional prediction utilizing machine learning, concurrency, and other computational biology techniques
Contributed to the curation of a comprehensive antibody/antigen mutation dataset

work.name: Department of Mathematics, UT Austin
summary: Collaborated with instructors on grading criteria, provided constructive feedback to students
Managed unforeseen challenges, including student medical emergencies and miscommunications, to ensure the smooth flow of the course

publications.name: Himanshu Reddy, Kangsheng Qi, Michael Zeosky, S. Stephen Yi. Understanding the Parallelizability of Gibbs Sampling for DNA Motif Finding. Status: Under Review at Computational and Structural Biology

education.institution: The University of Texas at Austin

projects.name: Understanding the Parallelizability of Gibbs Sampling for DNA Motif Finding (Paper in Review)
highlights: Investigated the impact of CUDA parallelizability on parameters and efficiency of Gibbs Sampling motif finding

projects.name: HyenaEnhancer (Project/Paper)
highlights: Adapted a Large Language Models (LLM) to predict the functional activity of enhancer sequences
Conducted a comparative analysis of LLM against Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) for enhancer prediction, exploring the advantages and limitations of each

projects.name: Student Record System (Project)
highlights: Designed and implemented a three-tier architecture framework utilizing a MySQL database for efficient management of student data, including class schedule and personal information
Ensured data persistence through MyBatis and integrated web functionalities using Jakarta Servlet
